Dentate gyrus of RHA11.Definition: Part of hippocampal formation; the dentate gyrus is characterized by the presence of a curved cell layer, densely packed with granule cells, i.e. cells that lacks basal dendrites but have an extensive apical dendritic tuft, extending into he molecular layer.  The granule cell layer is covered by a molecular layer and it encloses a polymorph layer, referred to as the hilus. The hilus is bounded by area CA3
